title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1156.8 - Appeal
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1156.8 - Appeal

State Regulations

Any person denied access to a record may, within 30 days, appeal such denial in writing to the chairman of the authority, or the chairman
of the subsidiary corporation, as the case may be. The time for deciding an
appeal shall commence upon receipt of a written appeal identifying the date of
requests for records, the records that were denied and the name and return
address of the appellant. The authority shall transmit to the Committee on Open

Government copies of all appeals upon receipt. The chairman shall inform the
appellant and the Committee on Open Government of his or her decision in
writing within 10 business days of the receipt of an appeal as specified
above. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 21

1156.8

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
